abstract.t: The framework for SCHC defines an abstract view of the rules, formalized through a YANG Data Model. In its original description, rules are static and shared by two endpoints. The use of YANG authorizes rules to be uploaded or modified in a SCHC instance and leads to some possible attacks if the changes are not controlled. This document defines a threat model, summarizes some possible attacks, and defines augmentation to the existing Data Model in order to restrict the changes in the rule and, therefore, the impact of possible attacks.
